metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14155 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large number after a (?C substring.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.3+esm1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.3+esm1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.3+esm1').
